rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment uses neutral language to report case status.
The segment uses plain verbs ('has not reported', 'have been reported') and lacks significant scale information paired with a moderate verb.
The segment reports absence of cases in one area (bare negation) but lacks explicit calming language.
'Missouri has not reported any H5 infections in dairy cattle' is a bare negation without explicit calming cues.
